steps.title: Search for a copy online.
steps.content: Search for a copy online. Go to onedrive.live.com/recoverykey and find your PC name and the recovery key. If you already have your recovery key, jump to our section about entering the recovery key .

steps.title: Search for a copy on a USB drive.
steps.content: Search for a copy on a USB drive. The USB drive should be in a safe place so that you can recover BitLocker. Plug the drive in when prompted to enter your recovery key to unlock your drive. If you have the key saved as a text file, you must manually open the file on a separate computer to see the recovery key.

steps.title: Search for a paper copy.
steps.content: Search for a paper copy. This should be stored in a safe location, so that no one can access the key and your data.

steps.title: Turn on your computer.
steps.content: Turn on your computer. Wait for the recovery screen to pop up.

steps.title: Enter the recovery key associated with your key ID to unlock your computer.
steps.content: Enter the recovery key associated with your key ID to unlock your computer. The recovery key is 25 to 48 characters long with dashes every five characters, so check that you have not mistyped the recovery key.

steps.title: Press "Enter" or click "Next" to proceed.
steps.content: Press "Enter" or click "Next" to proceed. If the recovery key is incorrect, then ensure that you did not mistype the recovery key and try again. If your recovery key doesn't work no matter what, jump ahead to learn how to reset your PC .

steps.title: Find the recovery key first
steps.content: Find the recovery key first . Note that resetting your PC will erase all data on your computer.

steps.title: Click "Skip this drive" or "Recovery options" or similar until the Windows RE tools screen appears.
steps.content: Click "Skip this drive" or "Recovery options" or similar until the Windows RE tools screen appears.

steps.title: Click on "Restore factory settings" or "Recover from the cloud".
steps.content: Click on "Restore factory settings" or "Recover from the cloud". Unfortunately, you are unable to reinstall Windows by clicking on "Reset my PC" or "Refresh my PC". Instead, you will get locked into BitLocker Recovery. Alternatively, reinstall Windows using an installation disc.

steps.title: Confirm that you want to do it.
steps.content: Confirm that you want to do it.

steps.title: Wait for re-installation.
steps.content: Wait for re-installation. Your PC will reinstall Windows through the following process: First, your PC will download the Windows installer (if there is not one built into Windows RE). Then, your PC will run the Windows installer. The installer will erase your drive and install Windows onto your PC. Finally, you will be prompted to complete initial setup, which should not be so hard, especially because Cortana guides you through setup on the Windows 10 Fall Creators Update (version 1709) and later.
